title: How to Make Mashed Potato Pizza

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Put water and a pinch of salt into a large pot.
Put the pan onto the stove and bring to the boil.
Put the potato chunks into the boiling water and cook for about 10-15 minutes until the potatoes are tender but not fully soft.
Drain the potatoes in a colander and place them in a large bowl.
Mash with a potato masher until the potatoes are properly mashed and combined.
Pour the milk into the potatoes and add a desired amount of salt for taste.
steps.description: Mash again with the potato masher. Set aside.

steps.headline: Roll out the pizza crust onto a 14 inch baking pan.
Prick and poke the pizza crust all over using a fork.
Bake the pizza crust in the oven for about fifteen minutes, until it has barely browned.
Cook the bacon over medium heat in a frying pan or saucepan.
steps.description: Leave about a tablespoon of bacon grease in the pan and drain the rest.

steps.headline: Stir in the peppers and onions and continue to cook.
steps.description: Cook for about 5-7 minutes, until the bacon has crisped nicely and the vegetables are tender.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).
Spread the mashed potatoes all around the pizza using a rubber spatula.
Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese, and bacon mixture on top of the pizza.
Place the pizza in the oven to bake for about 15-20 minutes, until the crust is golden brown and the cheese has completely melted.
Cut a slice of pizza using a pizza cutter.
steps.description: Lay a slice on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Put water and a pinch of salt into a large pot.  Put the pan onto the stove and bring to the boil.  Put the potato chunks into the boiling water and cook for about 10-15 minutes until the potatoes are tender but not fully soft.  Drain the potatoes in a colander and place them in a large bowl.  Mash with a potato masher until the potatoes are properly mashed and combined.  Pour the milk into the potatoes and add a desired amount of salt for taste. Mash again with the potato masher. Set aside. Roll out the pizza crust onto a 14 inch baking pan.  Prick and poke the pizza crust all over using a fork.  Bake the pizza crust in the oven for about fifteen minutes, until it has barely browned.  Cook the bacon over medium heat in a frying pan or saucepan. Leave about a tablespoon of bacon grease in the pan and drain the rest. Stir in the peppers and onions and continue to cook. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, until the bacon has crisped nicely and the vegetables are tender. Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).  Spread the mashed potatoes all around the pizza using a rubber spatula.  Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese, and bacon mixture on top of the pizza.  Place the pizza in the oven to bake for about 15-20 minutes, until the crust is golden brown and the cheese has completely melted.  Cut a slice of pizza using a pizza cutter. Lay a slice on a serving plate. Enjoy!
